result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas Arden Harder

records.addlTxt: 1:05 PM  Defendant Thomas Harder in court, in custody.  Attorney David John Winkel in court.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Plea Questionnaire submitted to Court.  State recites agreement, all parties agree.   As part of the agreement Case is dismissed and read in.

11:28 AM Defendant Thomas Arden Harder in court with attorney David John Winkel appears by zoom.  Defendant Thomas Arden Harder in custody appears by zoom.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Winkel indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.   State request court take Judicial Notice of Sawyer County Case 21CF318, Court takes Judicial Notice.   State calls witness, Sawyer County Sgt Gillis, Court sworn in witness.  State begins examination.  11:31 AM  Witness identified the DEF, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  11:33 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Winkel.    Attny Winkel no further questions. 11:35 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either.   State request for bind over.  Attny Winkel no arguement.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  
  Arraignment scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on April 6, 2022 at 11:15 am.

08:58 AM Defendant Thomas Arden Harder in court with attorney David John Winkel appears by telephone.  Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and updates address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Court enters NG Plea to Count 2 and 3.   Attny Winkel request preliminary hearing within time limits.    Attny to appear by zoom for hearing.   Court sets.  Bond Continues.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 6, 2022 at 11:15 am.
